thread.title: MIT at Coast Guard football capsule
thread.title_full: MIT at Coast Guard football capsule

author: Day Staff Reports
title: MIT at Coast Guard football capsule
text:
MIT at Coast Guard football capsule Published October 16. 2015 5:37PM Day Staff Reports 
Where: Cadet Memorial Field 
Records: MIT 1-4 overall, 1-1 New England Conference; Coast Guard 3-2, 2-0. 
Players to watch: Coast Guard, QB Derek Victory (91-for-165, 939 yards, 5 TDs, 3 INTs), RB Mike Clancy (48 carries, 170 yards, 3 TDs), WR Jordan Groff (27 catches, 246 yards, 2 TDs), WR Carter Provost (17 catches, 256 yards), SS Joe Rizzardi (45 tackles, 27 solo), LB Kyle Wood (44 tackles, 25 solo), FS Mark Behne (40 tackles, 3.5 tackles for loss, 3 INTs), P Tyler Henning (43.2 yards per kick). 
MIT: RB Adis Ojeda (753 yards, 8 TDs), QB John King (15-for-24, 179 yards, 3 TDs, 1 INT), QB Danny Callahan (62-for-136, 762 yards, 6 TDs, 7 INTs), WR Karson Ota (18 catches, 308 yards, 4 TDs), WR Seve Esparrago (21 catches, 232 yards, 2 TDs), LB Mitch Turley (46 tackles, 25 solo, 2 sacks), LB Anthony Emberley (35 tackles, 8 tackles for loss, 3 sacks). 
Analysis: A year after winning the NEFC title and reaching the second round of the NCAA Division III playoffs, the Engineers — despite being the preseason favorite again this season — have struggled, particularly on defense where they are allowing 33.4 points per game and a league worst 459.4 yards of total offense per game. King, a sophomore, will get the start at QB ahead of Callahan, a senior, who has thrown more interceptions (seven) than TDs (six). ... It's Homecoming Day for the Bears, who are coming off a bye week following a stirring 21-14 comeback win over Maine Maritime. In that game, Coast Guard overcame a 14-0 deficit and came up with three interceptions in the fourth quarter — two by Behne — to remain unbeaten in the NEFC. Behne also had a career-high 14 tackles to earn the prestigious Gold Helmet award. ... The Bears continue to get a solid contribution from Victory at quarterback. The junior, who will make his 23rd consecutive start, set the CGA career-passing yards record in the win over Maine Maritime. He has 4,686, breaking the mark of 4,569 set by by Jon Resch (2009-12) ... Henning also set a career record for career extra points (89) with three in that game, eclipsing the old record of 87 by David Lieberman (2004-07). Henning is also just two shy of the school record for field goals (28) currently held by Jacob Shackleford (2008-11).
